Palmer: â€œThis is a common sense bill and a straightforward way to provide more transparency on the billions of dollars we spend on federal real estate.â€

Sponsor of the â€œTransparency in Federal Buildings Projects Actâ€ @USRepGaryPalmer: â€œThis bill will ensure taxpayers know what projects have been proposed, how much they cost, and which have been approved.â€

Graves: â€œWeâ€™ve done this in recent years by creating a one-stop shop on the Committee Republicansâ€™ website. However, given GSAâ€™s role in this process, GSA should be doing the same with this important information, and this bill requires them to do that.â€

The Committee approved the â€œTransparency in Federal Buildings Projects Act.â€ Ranking Member @RepSamGraves: â€œRepublicans on this Committee have been and will continue to be committed to ensuring transparency in GSA real estate projects we approve.â€
Graves: â€œThis bill will help us get real numbers, increase transparency to the taxpayer, and help Congress make more informed decisions.â€

The Committee approved the â€œDisclosing Aid Spent to Ensure Relief (DISASTER) Act.  Ranking Member @RepSamGraves â€œYou would think we would know how much we actually spend on disasters, but we donâ€™t. We only have estimates.â€

Graves: â€œThis bill ensures that the billions of additional funds already collected to improve our ports and harbors are invested for their intended purpose without raising a single dime in new taxes.â€

Graves: â€œFarmers, manufacturers, and businesses across the country â€“ whether they are near the coast or not â€“ rely on ports for trade.  Every day, most Americans buy something that traveled through a port at some point.â€

Committee approved the Full Utilization of the Harbor Maintenance Trust Fund Act.  RM @RepSamGraves: â€œAmericaâ€™s ports and harbors are vital to the entire economy and are an integral part of our cohesive national infrastructure system.â€

Meadows: â€œThe DISASTER Act will provide Congress with real data on disaster spending and obligations across government â€“ increasing transparency and giving us critical information in our oversight of these programs.â€
Meadows: â€œWe need more than estimates on our disaster spending, and we need comprehensive information rather than the fragmented information we may get from just a few agencies.â€

Economic Development, Public Buildings, & Emergency Management Ranking Member @RepMarkMeadows: â€œTransparency and good data are critical to holding agencies accountable and ensuring we have the right information to identify needed reforms.â€

Westerman: â€œApproximately $9.3 billion in already collected revenue â€“ enough to address the Nationâ€™s harbor maintenance backlog â€“ sits idle. This bill would enable money collected for dredging and maintaining our ports and harbors to be fully spent for those purposes.â€
